user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_suspend_connection:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN void
MHD_suspend_connection (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *const daemon = connection->daemon;

#ifdef MHD_USE_THREADS
  mhd_assert ( (! MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon)) || \
               MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_ (daemon) || \
               MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_ (daemon->tid) );
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Cannot suspend connections without " \
                  "enabling MHD_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME!\n"));
#ifdef UPGRADE_SUPPORT
  if (NULL != connection->urh)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Error: connection scheduled for \"upgrade\" cannot " \
                 "be suspended.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    return;
  }
#endif /* UPGRADE_SUPPORT */
  internal_suspend_connection_ (connection);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_suspend_connection:
#define MHD_USE_THREADS 1
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_(d) (0!=(d->options&(MHD_USE_INTERNAL_POLLING_THREAD)))
...
#define MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_(d) (0!=((d)->options&MHD_USE_THREAD_PER_CONNECTION))
...
#define MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_(hndl_id) MHD_thread_ID_is_current_thread_((hndl_id).ID)
...
#define MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME 8192
...
#define MHD_PANIC(msg) do{mhd_panic(mhd_panic_cls,__FILE__,__LINE__,msg);BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED;}while(0)
...
#define UPGRADE_SUPPORT 1
...
#define HAVE_MESSAGES 1
...
void
MHD_DLOG (const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
          const char *format,
          ...)
{
  va_list va;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG))
    return;
  va_start (va, format);
  daemon->custom_error_log (daemon->custom_error_log_cls,
                            format,
                            va);
  va_end (va);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other conditional/loop controlling expressions in the provided code do not appear to be invariant: - The runtime if statements use structure members (daemon->options, connection->urh) and thus are not compile-time invariant. - The assertion macro mhd_assert(ignore) is defined as ((void)0), so the assertion call in the function is removed by the macro and does not introduce a controlling expression to be checked. - Preprocessor conditionals (#ifdef MHD_USE_THREADS, #ifdef UPGRADE_SUPPORT, #ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES) are compile-time configuration switches and are not subject to Rule 14.3 which targets controlling expressions in C language constructs. - MHD_DLOG contains a runtime if that depends on daemon->options and calls a variadic logging function; its controlling expression is not invariant. Therefore these fragments do not require investigation under Rule 14.3.
